Package com.stratic.tpl

Class Tag

java.lang.Object
com.stratic.tpl.Tag
public final class Tag extends Object
A tag is a named template part. It defines two things:
  • A location where nested content can be added.
  • A default template for its content.
A tag can be used to play both roles or only one of them.

For example, if we have the following template for a mail: 


 Subject: ${subject}
 To:      <tag:recipient>${name};</tag:recipient>;
 Body:    ${body}
The notation "<tag:recipient>${name}</tag:recipient>" defines :
  • A tag named 'recipient' starting at <tag:recipient> and ending at </tag:recipient>.
  • The position where the content will be inserted is defined by the first character of '<tag:' ( the '<').
  • The default template for its content is defined between the starting mark ( <tag:recipient> ) and the ending one ( </tag:recipient> ).
The default content can be omitted. Example : 

 Subject: ${subject}
 To:      <tag:recipient/>
 Body:    ${body}
In this case, the nature of the content to add must be defined explicitly using the add method.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public final Template create()
      Create a new template inside this tag using it's default template.

      Example :

      if we use the previous mail template example defined as follow : 

      
 Subject:${subject}
 To:<tag:to>${name};</tag:to>
 Body:${body}
      To set the recipients, using the default template provided by "to" the tag, the code will look like following one : 
      

	    Template mail;
	    ...
	    Tag recipients = mail.getTag("to");		        // get a handle on the "to" tag
	    recipients.create().set("name", "John Doe");	// Create a new recipient
	    recipients.create().set("name", "Peter Smith");	// Create another one
      With this function, the default content is created in place. It's is a shortcut for: 
      

	    this.add( this.getFactory(). create() );
      Returns:
      the newly created template.

    • add

      public final Template add(Template tpl)
      Add an existing template content at this tag place.
      Parameters:
      tpl - An existing template to add at this place. If there is already some content, then it is added at the end.
      Returns:
      The newly added template.

    • getFactory

      public final Factory getFactory()
      Gets the factory used to build default content templates for this tag.
      Returns:
      this tag default factory.

    • getFactory

      public final Factory getFactory(String name)
      Gets the factory of a nested tag.
      Parameters:
      name - Nested tag reference. It can be simply a tag name. When the target tag is nested deeply, then it's multiple tags names separated by dots (like in "customer.address.country").
      Returns:
      Corresponding factory or null if no factory was found with this reference.

    • isEmpty

      public final boolean isEmpty()
      Check if this tag is empty.

      It is a shortcut for : "size() == 0".

      Returns:
      true if there is nothing at this place, else false.

    • isNotEmpty

      public final boolean isNotEmpty()
      Check if there is existing content at this place.

      It is a shortcut for: "size() != 0 ".

      Returns:
      true if there is content, else false.
